question: The paraneoplastic syndrome associated with Hodgkin's disease is -
exp: Ans. is 'c' i. e., Cerebellar degenerative disease CNS Paraneoplastic syndromes: Syndrome. Target. Tumour* Subacute cerebellar degeneration. Purkinje cell. Hodgkin lymphoma, Breast, Ovary, Small cell Ca lung, Neuroblastoma* Limbic encephalitis. Various neurons. SCLC, Neuroblastoma* Brainstem encephalitis. In mesial temporal lobe, brainstem. Testicular, others* Subacute sensory. Dorsal root ganglion. SCLC, neuropathyneuron. Neuroblastoma* Opsoclonus myoclonus. Unknown (presumed brain stem). Neuroblastoma, Breast* Retinal degeneration. Photoreceptors. SCLC* Stiff-man syndrome. Spinal interneuron. Breast* Lambert-Eaton myasthenic syndrome. Presynaptic terminals at neuromuscular junction. SCLC

question: Most common lymphoma associated with Sicca syndrome is -
exp: Ans. is 'a' i. e., MALToma o The most common histologic subtype of non-Hodgkin lymphoma in Sjogren syndrome is mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue (MALT) lymphoma, which can develop in any non-lymphoid tissue infiltrated by periepithelial lymphoid tissue-most commonly the salivary' glands, but also the stomach, nasopharynx, skin, liver, kidneys, and lungs.

question: Which of the following are lymphomas is associated with HTLV-I virus infection?
exp: Ans. is 'c' i. e., Adult T cell leukemia and lymphoma Virus. Associated disease. HTLV -1 virus. Adult T cell lymphoma / leukemia (ATL). Tropical spastic paraparesis (HTLV associated myelopathy or HAM)HTLV - II virus- T cell variant of hairy cell leukemia (not yet conclusively established)

question: Most common lymph node involved in Hodgkin's lymphoma is?
exp: Ans. (b) Cervical. Ref: Wintrobe's clinical hematology 12/e, chapter 96, Table 96. 3, William's hematology 8/e, ch 99
